channel.title: Errors and interactivity :: Web Apps in Lisp: Know-how
channel.description: In all frameworks, we can choose the level of interactivity. The web framework can be interactive in different degrees. What should it do when an error happens? not being interactive: it returns a 404 page and prints the error output on the REPL not interactive but developper friendly: it can show the lisp error message on the HTML page, as well as the full Lisp backtrace it can let the developper have the interactive debugger: in that case the framework doesnâ€™t catch the error, it lets it pass through, and we the developper deal with it as in a normal Slime session.
